bank

Interface BankDriver


  • public interface BankDriver
    The BankDriver interface is used to access a particular bank. The client program first calls connect over this interface and then requests the bank.
    Version:
    3.0
    Author:
    Dominik Gruntz
    See Also:
    Bank

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(String[] args)
      Connects to an implementation of a bank.
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the server which is serving the bank.
      Bank getBank()
      Return the bank which is served by that server.

    • Method Detail

      • connect

        void connect(String[] args)
      throws IOException
        Connects to an implementation of a bank. Parameters which designate e.g. the name or number of the server and possibly other arguments may be passed.
        Parameters:
        args - array of implementation specific arguments
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • disconnect

        void disconnect()
         throws IOException
        Disconnects from the server which is serving the bank.
        Throws:
        IOException - if a remoting or communication problem occurs

      • getBank

        Bank getBank()
        Return the bank which is served by that server. Before getBank can be invoked, connect must be called. getBank must have singleton semantics, i.e. it should return the same instance upon subsequent calls. After disconnect has been called getBank returns null.
        Returns:
        the bank to which this driver instance has been connected.
        See Also:
        connect(java.lang.String[]), Bank
